017package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.cielab;
018
019import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color;
020import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture;
021import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion;
022import com.badlogic.gdx.math.MathUtils;
023import com.badlogic.gdx.math.Rectangle;
024import com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.FloatColors;
025
026import static com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.cielab.ColorfulBatch.*;
027
028/**
029 * Holds the geometry, color, and texture information for drawing 2D sprites using {@link ColorfulBatch}. A
030 * ColorfulSprite has a position and a size given as width and height. The position is relative to the origin of the
031 * coordinate system specified via {@link ColorfulBatch#begin()} and the respective matrices. A ColorfulSprite is always
032 * rectangular and its position (x, y) are located in the bottom left corner of that rectangle. A ColorfulSprite also
033 * has an origin around which rotations and scaling are performed (that is, the origin is not modified by rotation and
034 * scaling). The origin is given relative to the bottom left corner of the ColorfulSprite, its position.
035 *
036 * @author mzechner
037 * @author Nathan Sweet
038 * @author Tommy Ettinger
039 */
040public class ColorfulSprite extends TextureRegion {
041    public static final int VERTEX_SIZE = 2 + 1 + 2 + 1;
042    public static final int SPRITE_SIZE = 4 * VERTEX_SIZE;
043
044    private final float[] vertices = new float[SPRITE_SIZE];
045    private float x, y;
046    private float width, height;
047    private float originX, originY;
048    private float rotation;
049    private float scaleX = 1, scaleY = 1;
050    private boolean dirty = true;
051    private Rectangle bounds;
052
053    /**
054     * Creates an uninitialized sprite. The sprite will need a texture region and bounds set before it can be drawn.
055     */
056    public ColorfulSprite() {
057        setTweakedColor(Palette.GRAY, TWEAK_RESET);
058    }
059
060    /**
061     * Creates a sprite with width, height, and texture region equal to the size of the texture.
062     *
063     * @param texture A Texture that will be used in full for this ColorfulSprite.
064     */
065    public ColorfulSprite(Texture texture) {
066        this(texture, 0, 0, texture.getWidth(), texture.getHeight());
067    }
068
069    /**
070     * Creates a sprite with width, height, and texture region equal to the specified size. The texture region's upper left corner
071     * will be 0,0.
072     *
073     * @param texture   A Texture that will have some of its area used for this ColorfulSprite, starting at 0,0 in the upper left.
074     * @param srcWidth  The width of the texture region. May be negative to flip the sprite when drawn.
075     * @param srcHeight The height of the texture region. May be negative to flip the sprite when drawn.
076     */
077    public ColorfulSprite(Texture texture, int srcWidth, int srcHeight) {
078        this(texture, 0, 0, srcWidth, srcHeight);
079    }
080
081    /**
082     * Creates a sprite with width, height, and texture region equal to the specified size.
083     *
084     * @param texture   A Texture that will have some of its area used for this ColorfulSprite, starting at srcX,srcY in the upper left.
085     * @param srcX      The x-coordinate for the upper left corner of the region to use.
086     * @param srcY      The y-coordinate for the upper left corner of the region to use.
087     * @param srcWidth  The width of the texture region. May be negative to flip the sprite when drawn.
088     * @param srcHeight The height of the texture region. May be negative to flip the sprite when drawn.
089     */
090    public ColorfulSprite(Texture texture, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth, int srcHeight) {
091        if (texture == null) throw new IllegalArgumentException("texture cannot be null.");
092        setTexture(texture);
093        setRegion(srcX, srcY, srcWidth, srcHeight);
094        setTweakedColor(Palette.GRAY, TWEAK_RESET);
095        setSize(Math.abs(srcWidth), Math.abs(srcHeight));
096        setOrigin(width * 0.5f, height * 0.5f);
097    }
098
099    /**
100     * Creates a sprite based on a specific TextureRegion, the new sprite's region is a copy of the parameter region - altering one
101     * does not affect the other
102     *
103     * @param region A TextureRegion that will have relevant data copied into this ColorfulSprite.
104     */
105    public ColorfulSprite(TextureRegion region) {
106        setRegion(region);
107        setTweakedColor(Palette.GRAY, TWEAK_RESET);
108        setSize(region.getRegionWidth(), region.getRegionHeight());
109        setOrigin(width * 0.5f, height * 0.5f);
110    }
111
112    /**
113     * Creates a sprite with width, height, and texture region equal to the specified size, relative to specified sprite's texture
114     * region.
115     *
116     * @param region    A TextureRegion that this will use for its Texture and as a basis for the relative coordinates in that Texture.
117     * @param srcX      Number of pixels to add to the texture coordinates of {@code region} on the x-axis.
118     * @param srcY      Number of pixels to add to the texture coordinates of {@code region} on the y-axis.
119     * @param srcWidth  The width of the texture region. May be negative to flip the sprite when drawn.
120     * @param srcHeight The height of the texture region. May be negative to flip the sprite when drawn.
121     */
122    public ColorfulSprite(TextureRegion region, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth, int srcHeight) {
123        setRegion(region, srcX, srcY, srcWidth, srcHeight);
124        setTweakedColor(Palette.GRAY, TWEAK_RESET);
125        setSize(Math.abs(srcWidth), Math.abs(srcHeight));
126        setOrigin(width * 0.5f, height * 0.5f);
127    }
128
129    /**
130     * Creates a colorfulSprite that is a copy in every way of the specified colorfulSprite.
131     *
132     * @param colorfulSprite A ColorfulSprite that will be copied exactly.
133     */
134    public ColorfulSprite(ColorfulSprite colorfulSprite) {
135        set(colorfulSprite);
136    }
137
138    /**
139     * Make this colorfulSprite a copy in every way of the specified colorfulSprite
140     *
141     * @param colorfulSprite A ColorfulSprite that will be copied exactly.
142     */
143    public void set(ColorfulSprite colorfulSprite) {
144        if (colorfulSprite == null) throw new IllegalArgumentException("colorfulSprite cannot be null.");
145        System.arraycopy(colorfulSprite.vertices, 0, vertices, 0, SPRITE_SIZE);
146        setRegion(colorfulSprite);
147        x = colorfulSprite.x;
148        y = colorfulSprite.y;
149        width = colorfulSprite.width;
150        height = colorfulSprite.height;
151        setRegionWidth(colorfulSprite.getRegionWidth());
152        setRegionHeight(colorfulSprite.getRegionHeight());
153        originX = colorfulSprite.originX;
154        originY = colorfulSprite.originY;
155        rotation = colorfulSprite.rotation;
156        scaleX = colorfulSprite.scaleX;
157        scaleY = colorfulSprite.scaleY;
158        setTweakedColor(colorfulSprite.vertices[C1], colorfulSprite.vertices[T1]);
159        if (colorfulSprite.bounds != null)
160            bounds = new Rectangle(colorfulSprite.bounds);
161        dirty = colorfulSprite.dirty;
162    }
163
164    /**
165     * Sets the position and size of the sprite when drawn, before scaling and rotation are applied. If origin, rotation, or scale
166     * are changed, it is slightly more efficient to set the bounds after those operations.
167     *
168     * @param x      The x-position of the ColorfulSprite in world space.
169     * @param y      The y-position of the ColorfulSprite in world space.
170     * @param width  The width to display the ColorfulSprite with.
171     * @param height The height to display the ColorfulSprite with.
172     */
173    public void setBounds(float x, float y, float width, float height) {
174        this.x = x;
175        this.y = y;
176        this.width = width;
177        this.height = height;
178
179        if (dirty) return;
180
181        float x2 = x + width;
182        float y2 = y + height;
183        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
184        vertices[X1] = x;
185        vertices[Y1] = y;
186
187        vertices[X2] = x;
188        vertices[Y2] = y2;
189
190        vertices[X3] = x2;
191        vertices[Y3] = y2;
192
193        vertices[X4] = x2;
194        vertices[Y4] = y;
195
196        if (rotation != 0 || scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) dirty = true;
197    }
198
199    /**
200     * Sets the size of the sprite when drawn, before scaling and rotation are applied. If origin, rotation, or scale are changed,
201     * it is slightly more efficient to set the size after those operations. If both position and size are to be changed, it is
202     * better to use {@link #setBounds(float, float, float, float)}.
203     *
204     * @param width  The width to display the ColorfulSprite with.
205     * @param height The height to display the ColorfulSprite with.
206     */
207    public void setSize(float width, float height) {
208        this.width = width;
209        this.height = height;
210
211        if (dirty) return;
212
213        float x2 = x + width;
214        float y2 = y + height;
215        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
216        vertices[X1] = x;
217        vertices[Y1] = y;
218
219        vertices[X2] = x;
220        vertices[Y2] = y2;
221
222        vertices[X3] = x2;
223        vertices[Y3] = y2;
224
225        vertices[X4] = x2;
226        vertices[Y4] = y;
227
228        if (rotation != 0 || scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) dirty = true;
229    }
230
231    /**
232     * Sets the position where the sprite will be drawn. If origin, rotation, or scale are changed, it is slightly more efficient
233     * to set the position after those operations. If both position and size are to be changed, it is better to use
234     * {@link #setBounds(float, float, float, float)}.
235     *
236     * @param x The x-position of the ColorfulSprite in world space.
237     * @param y The y-position of the ColorfulSprite in world space.
238     */
239    public void setPosition(float x, float y) {
240        translate(x - this.x, y - this.y);
241    }
242
243    /**
244     * Sets the position where the sprite will be drawn, relative to its current origin.
245     *
246     * @param x The adjustment to make to the x-position, relative to the current origin.
247     * @param y The adjustment to make to the y-position, relative to the current origin.
248     */
249    public void setOriginBasedPosition(float x, float y) {
250        setPosition(x - this.originX, y - this.originY);
251    }
252
253    /**
254     * Sets the x position where the sprite will be drawn. If origin, rotation, or scale are changed, it is slightly more efficient
255     * to set the position after those operations. If both position and size are to be changed, it is better to use
256     * {@link #setBounds(float, float, float, float)}.
257     *
258     * @param x The x-position of the ColorfulSprite in world space.
259     */
260    public void setX(float x) {
261        translateX(x - this.x);
262    }
263
264    /**
265     * Sets the y position where the sprite will be drawn. If origin, rotation, or scale are changed, it is slightly more efficient
266     * to set the position after those operations. If both position and size are to be changed, it is better to use
267     * {@link #setBounds(float, float, float, float)}.
268     *
269     * @param y The y-position of the ColorfulSprite in world space.
270     */
271    public void setY(float y) {
272        translateY(y - this.y);
273    }
274
275    /**
276     * Sets the x position so that it is centered on the given x parameter.
277     *
278     * @param x The x-position of the center of the ColorfulSprite in world space.
279     */
280    public void setCenterX(float x) {
281        setX(x - width * 0.5f);
282    }
283
284    /**
285     * Sets the y position so that it is centered on the given y parameter.
286     *
287     * @param y The y-position of the center of the ColorfulSprite in world space.
288     */
289    public void setCenterY(float y) {
290        setY(y - height * 0.5f);
291    }
292
293    /**
294     * Sets the position so that the sprite is centered on (x, y).
295     *
296     * @param x The x-position of the center of the ColorfulSprite in world space.
297     * @param y The y-position of the center of the ColorfulSprite in world space.
298     */
299    public void setCenter(float x, float y) {
300        setCenterX(x);
301        setCenterY(y);
302    }
303
304    /**
305     * Sets the x position relative to the current position where the sprite will be drawn. If origin, rotation, or scale are
306     * changed, it is slightly more efficient to translate after those operations.
307     *
308     * @param xAmount How much to move the ColorfulSprite on the x-axis, in world space.
309     */
310    public void translateX(float xAmount) {
311        this.x += xAmount;
312
313        if (dirty) return;
314
315        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
316        vertices[X1] += xAmount;
317        vertices[X2] += xAmount;
318        vertices[X3] += xAmount;
319        vertices[X4] += xAmount;
320    }
321
322    /**
323     * Sets the y position relative to the current position where the sprite will be drawn. If origin, rotation, or scale are
324     * changed, it is slightly more efficient to translate after those operations.
325     *
326     * @param yAmount How much to move the ColorfulSprite on the y-axis, in world space.
327     */
328    public void translateY(float yAmount) {
329        y += yAmount;
330
331        if (dirty) return;
332
333        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
334        vertices[Y1] += yAmount;
335        vertices[Y2] += yAmount;
336        vertices[Y3] += yAmount;
337        vertices[Y4] += yAmount;
338    }
339
340    /**
341     * Sets the position relative to the current position where the sprite will be drawn. If origin, rotation, or scale are
342     * changed, it is slightly more efficient to translate after those operations.
343     *
344     * @param xAmount How much to move the ColorfulSprite on the x-axis, in world space.
345     * @param yAmount How much to move the ColorfulSprite on the y-axis, in world space.
346     */
347    public void translate(float xAmount, float yAmount) {
348        x += xAmount;
349        y += yAmount;
350
351        if (dirty) return;
352
353        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
354        vertices[X1] += xAmount;
355        vertices[Y1] += yAmount;
356
357        vertices[X2] += xAmount;
358        vertices[Y2] += yAmount;
359
360        vertices[X3] += xAmount;
361        vertices[Y3] += yAmount;
362
363        vertices[X4] += xAmount;
364        vertices[Y4] += yAmount;
365    }
366
367    /**
368     * Sets the color used to tint this sprite. Default is {@link Palette#GRAY}, which makes no changes to the color.
369     * Use {@link ColorTools#cielab(float, float, float, float)} or a predefined color from {@link Palette} if you
370     * don't have a color currently.
371     *
372     * @param color the packed float color used to add to the L/A/B channels of the current sprite, as well as the multiplier for alpha
373     */
374    public void setColor(final float color) {
375        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
376        vertices[C1] = color;
377        vertices[C2] = color;
378        vertices[C3] = color;
379        vertices[C4] = color;
380    }
381
382    /**
383     * Sets the color used to tint this sprite and the tweak that affects how that color will be treated.
384     * Default color is {@link Palette#GRAY}, which makes no changes to the color, and default tweak is
385     * {@link ColorfulBatch#TWEAK_RESET}, which resets any changes to the tweak back to a neutral state. You can easily
386     * get a tweak value with {@link ColorTools#cielab(float, float, float, float)}, just using the last parameter
387     * to represent contrast.
388     *
389     * @param color the packed float color used to add to the L/A/B channels of the current sprite, as well as the multiplier for alpha
390     * @param tweak the packed float used to multiply the L/A/B channels, as well as the setting for contrast
391     */
392    public void setTweakedColor(final float color, final float tweak) {
393        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
394        vertices[C1] = color;
395        vertices[C2] = color;
396        vertices[C3] = color;
397        vertices[C4] = color;
398        vertices[T1] = tweak;
399        vertices[T2] = tweak;
400        vertices[T3] = tweak;
401        vertices[T4] = tweak;
402    }
403
404    /**
405     * Sets the color used to tint this sprite and the tweak that affects how that color will be treated.
406     * Default color is {@link Palette#GRAY}, which makes no changes to the color, and default tweak is
407     * {@link ColorfulBatch#TWEAK_RESET}, which resets any changes to the tweak back to a neutral state. You can easily
408     * get a tweak value with {@link ColorTools#cielab(float, float, float, float)}, just using the last parameter
409     * to represent contrast.
410     *
411     * @param addL     how much lightness to add; darkest is 0f, neutral is 0.5f, lightest is 1f
412     * @param addA     how much to add on the cyan/red axis; more cyan is 0f, neutral is 0.5f, more red is 1f
413     * @param addB     how much to add on the blue/yellow axis; more blue is 0f, neutral is 0.5f, more yellow is 1f
414     * @param mulAlpha how much to multiply alpha by; fully transparent is 0f, neutral is 1f
415     * @param mulL     how much source lightness should be multiplied by; darkest is 0f, neutral is 0.5f, lightest is 1f
416     * @param mulA     how much the source's cyan/red axis should be multiplied by; no cyan/red is 0f, neutral is 0.5f, max cyan/red is 1f
417     * @param mulB     how much the source's blue/yellow axis should be multiplied by; no blue/yellow is 0f, neutral is 0.5f, max blue/yellow is 1f
418     * @param contrast how to affect the curvature of lightness in the source; 0f makes lightness very even, 0.5f doesn't change lightness, and 1f makes light colors lighter and dark colors darker
419     */
420    public void setTweakedColor(float addL, float addA, float addB, float mulAlpha, float mulL, float mulA, float mulB, float contrast) {
421        final float color = ColorTools.cielab(addL, addA, addB, mulAlpha),
422                tweak = ColorTools.cielab(mulL, mulA, mulB, contrast);
423        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
424        vertices[C1] = color;
425        vertices[C2] = color;
426        vertices[C3] = color;
427        vertices[C4] = color;
428        vertices[T1] = tweak;
429        vertices[T2] = tweak;
430        vertices[T3] = tweak;
431        vertices[T4] = tweak;
432    }
433
434    /**
435     * Sets the tweak that affects how the rendered color will be treated.
436     * Default tweak is {@link ColorfulBatch#TWEAK_RESET}, which resets any changes to the tweak back to a neutral
437     * state. You can easily get a tweak value with {@link ColorTools#cielab(float, float, float, float)}, just
438     * using the last parameter to represent contrast.
439     *
440     * @param tweak the packed float used to multiply the L/A/B channels, as well as the setting for contrast
441     */
442    public void setTweak(final float tweak) {
443        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
444        vertices[T1] = tweak;
445        vertices[T2] = tweak;
446        vertices[T3] = tweak;
447        vertices[T4] = tweak;
448    }
449
450    /**
451     * Given an RGBA8888 Color from libGDX, this converts that to an CIELAB color as a packed float and sets the color of
452     * the sprite using that.
453     *
454     * @param color a libGDX RGBA8888 Color
455     */
456    public void setColor(Color color) {
457        setColor(ColorTools.fromColor(color));
458    }
459
460    /**
461     * Sets the alpha portion of the color used to tint this sprite.
462     */
463    public void setAlpha(float alpha) {
464        float color = vertices[C1];
465        if (ColorTools.alpha(color) != alpha) {
466            color = FloatColors.setAlpha(color, alpha);
467            final float[] vertices = this.vertices;
468            vertices[C1] = color;
469            vertices[C2] = color;
470            vertices[C3] = color;
471            vertices[C4] = color;
472        }
473    }
474
475    /**
476     * @see #setColor(float)
477     */
478    public void setColor(float L, float A, float B, float alpha) {
479        final float color = ColorTools.cielab(L, A, B, alpha);
480        final float[] vertices = this.vertices;
481        vertices[C1] = color;
482        vertices[C2] = color;
483        vertices[C3] = color;
484        vertices[C4] = color;
485    }
486
487    /**
488     * @see #setTweak(float)
489     */
490    public void setTweak(float L, float A, float B, float contrast) {
491        final float tweak = ColorTools.cielab(L, A, B, contrast);
492        final float[] vertices = this.vertices;
493        vertices[C1] = tweak;
494        vertices[C2] = tweak;
495        vertices[C3] = tweak;
496        vertices[C4] = tweak;
497    }
498
499    /**
500     * Exactly the same as {@link #setColor(float)}.
501     *
502     * @see #setColor(float)
503     */
504    public void setPackedColor(float packedColor) {
505        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
506        vertices[C1] = packedColor;
507        vertices[C2] = packedColor;
508        vertices[C3] = packedColor;
509        vertices[C4] = packedColor;
510    }
511
512    /**
513     * Sets the origin in relation to the sprite's position for scaling and rotation.
514     */
515    public void setOrigin(float originX, float originY) {
516        this.originX = originX;
517        this.originY = originY;
518        dirty = true;
519    }
520
521    /**
522     * Place origin in the center of the sprite
523     */
524    public void setOriginCenter() {
525        this.originX = width * 0.5f;
526        this.originY = height * 0.5f;
527        dirty = true;
528    }
529
530    /**
531     * Sets the rotation of the sprite in degrees. Rotation is centered on the origin set in {@link #setOrigin(float, float)}
532     */
533    public void setRotation(float degrees) {
534        this.rotation = degrees;
535        dirty = true;
536    }
537
538    /**
539     * @return the rotation of the sprite in degrees
540     */
541    public float getRotation() {
542        return rotation;
543    }
544
545    /**
546     * Sets the sprite's rotation in degrees relative to the current rotation. Rotation is centered on the origin set in
547     * {@link #setOrigin(float, float)}
548     */
549    public void rotate(float degrees) {
550        if (degrees == 0) return;
551        rotation += degrees;
552        dirty = true;
553    }
554
555    /**
556     * Rotates this sprite 90 degrees in-place by rotating the texture coordinates. This rotation is unaffected by
557     * {@link #setRotation(float)} and {@link #rotate(float)}.
558     */
559    public void rotate90(boolean clockwise) {
560        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
561
562        if (clockwise) {
563            float temp = vertices[V1];
564            vertices[V1] = vertices[V4];
565            vertices[V4] = vertices[V3];
566            vertices[V3] = vertices[V2];
567            vertices[V2] = temp;
568
569            temp = vertices[U1];
570            vertices[U1] = vertices[U4];
571            vertices[U4] = vertices[U3];
572            vertices[U3] = vertices[U2];
573            vertices[U2] = temp;
574        } else {
575            float temp = vertices[V1];
576            vertices[V1] = vertices[V2];
577            vertices[V2] = vertices[V3];
578            vertices[V3] = vertices[V4];
579            vertices[V4] = temp;
580
581            temp = vertices[U1];
582            vertices[U1] = vertices[U2];
583            vertices[U2] = vertices[U3];
584            vertices[U3] = vertices[U4];
585            vertices[U4] = temp;
586        }
587    }
588
589    /**
590     * Sets the sprite's scale for both X and Y uniformly. The sprite scales out from the origin. This will not affect the values
591     * returned by {@link #getWidth()} and {@link #getHeight()}
592     */
593    public void setScale(float scaleXY) {
594        this.scaleX = scaleXY;
595        this.scaleY = scaleXY;
596        dirty = true;
597    }
598
599    /**
600     * Sets the sprite's scale for both X and Y. The sprite scales out from the origin. This will not affect the values returned by
601     * {@link #getWidth()} and {@link #getHeight()}
602     */
603    public void setScale(float scaleX, float scaleY) {
604        this.scaleX = scaleX;
605        this.scaleY = scaleY;
606        dirty = true;
607    }
608
609    /**
610     * Sets the sprite's scale relative to the current scale. for example: original scale 2 → sprite.scale(4) → final scale 6.
611     * The sprite scales out from the origin. This will not affect the values returned by {@link #getWidth()} and
612     * {@link #getHeight()}
613     */
614    public void scale(float amount) {
615        this.scaleX += amount;
616        this.scaleY += amount;
617        dirty = true;
618    }
619
620    /**
621     * Returns the packed vertices, colors, and texture coordinates for this sprite.
622     */
623    public float[] getVertices() {
624        if (dirty) {
625            dirty = false;
626
627            float[] vertices = this.vertices;
628            float localX = -originX;
629            float localY = -originY;
630            float localX2 = localX + width;
631            float localY2 = localY + height;
632            float worldOriginX = this.x - localX;
633            float worldOriginY = this.y - localY;
634            if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
635                localX *= scaleX;
636                localY *= scaleY;
637                localX2 *= scaleX;
638                localY2 *= scaleY;
639            }
640            if (rotation != 0) {
641                final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
642                final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
643                final float localXCos = localX * cos;
644                final float localXSin = localX * sin;
645                final float localYCos = localY * cos;
646                final float localYSin = localY * sin;
647                final float localX2Cos = localX2 * cos;
648                final float localX2Sin = localX2 * sin;
649                final float localY2Cos = localY2 * cos;
650                final float localY2Sin = localY2 * sin;
651
652                final float x1 = localXCos - localYSin + worldOriginX;
653                final float y1 = localYCos + localXSin + worldOriginY;
654                vertices[X1] = x1;
655                vertices[Y1] = y1;
656
657                final float x2 = localXCos - localY2Sin + worldOriginX;
658                final float y2 = localY2Cos + localXSin + worldOriginY;
659                vertices[X2] = x2;
660                vertices[Y2] = y2;
661
662                final float x3 = localX2Cos - localY2Sin + worldOriginX;
663                final float y3 = localY2Cos + localX2Sin + worldOriginY;
664                vertices[X3] = x3;
665                vertices[Y3] = y3;
666
667                vertices[X4] = x1 + (x3 - x2);
668                vertices[Y4] = y3 - (y2 - y1);
669            } else {
670                final float x1 = localX + worldOriginX;
671                final float y1 = localY + worldOriginY;
672                final float x2 = localX2 + worldOriginX;
673                final float y2 = localY2 + worldOriginY;
674
675                vertices[X1] = x1;
676                vertices[Y1] = y1;
677
678                vertices[X2] = x1;
679                vertices[Y2] = y2;
680
681                vertices[X3] = x2;
682                vertices[Y3] = y2;
683
684                vertices[X4] = x2;
685                vertices[Y4] = y1;
686            }
687        }
688        return vertices;
689    }
690
691    /**
692     * Returns the bounding axis aligned {@link Rectangle} that bounds this sprite. The rectangles x and y coordinates describe its
693     * bottom left corner. If you change the position or size of the sprite, you have to fetch the triangle again for it to be
694     * recomputed.
695     *
696     * @return the bounding Rectangle
697     */
698    public Rectangle getBoundingRectangle() {
699        final float[] vertices = getVertices();
700
701        float minx = vertices[X1];
702        float miny = vertices[Y1];
703        float maxx = vertices[X1];
704        float maxy = vertices[Y1];
705
706        minx = Math.min(minx, vertices[X2]);
707        minx = Math.min(minx, vertices[X3]);
708        minx = Math.min(minx, vertices[X4]);
709
710        maxx = Math.max(maxx, vertices[X2]);
711        maxx = Math.max(maxx, vertices[X3]);
712        maxx = Math.max(maxx, vertices[X4]);
713
714        miny = Math.min(miny, vertices[Y2]);
715        miny = Math.min(miny, vertices[Y3]);
716        miny = Math.min(miny, vertices[Y4]);
717
718        maxy = Math.max(maxy, vertices[Y2]);
719        maxy = Math.max(maxy, vertices[Y3]);
720        maxy = Math.max(maxy, vertices[Y4]);
721
722        if (bounds == null) bounds = new Rectangle();
723        bounds.x = minx;
724        bounds.y = miny;
725        bounds.width = maxx - minx;
726        bounds.height = maxy - miny;
727        return bounds;
728    }
729
730    public void draw(ColorfulBatch batch) {
731        batch.drawExactly(getTexture(), getVertices(), 0, SPRITE_SIZE);
732    }
733
734    public void draw(ColorfulBatch batch, float alphaModulation) {
735        final float oldAlpha = ColorTools.alpha(getColor());
736        setAlpha(oldAlpha * alphaModulation);
737        draw(batch);
738        setAlpha(oldAlpha);
739    }
740
741    public float getX() {
742        return x;
743    }
744
745    public float getY() {
746        return y;
747    }
748
749    /**
750     * @return the width of the sprite, not accounting for scale.
751     */
752    public float getWidth() {
753        return width;
754    }
755
756    /**
757     * @return the height of the sprite, not accounting for scale.
758     */
759    public float getHeight() {
760        return height;
761    }
762
763    /**
764     * The origin influences {@link #setPosition(float, float)}, {@link #setRotation(float)} and the expansion direction of scaling
765     * {@link #setScale(float, float)}
766     */
767    public float getOriginX() {
768        return originX;
769    }
770
771    /**
772     * The origin influences {@link #setPosition(float, float)}, {@link #setRotation(float)} and the expansion direction of scaling
773     * {@link #setScale(float, float)}
774     */
775    public float getOriginY() {
776        return originY;
777    }
778
779    /**
780     * X scale of the sprite, independent of size set by {@link #setSize(float, float)}
781     */
782    public float getScaleX() {
783        return scaleX;
784    }
785
786    /**
787     * Y scale of the sprite, independent of size set by {@link #setSize(float, float)}
788     */
789    public float getScaleY() {
790        return scaleY;
791    }
792
793    /**
794     * Returns the color of this sprite. If the returned instance is manipulated, {@link #setColor(float)} must be called
795     * afterward.
796     *
797     * @return a packed float color used to add to the L/A/B channels of the current sprite, as well as the multiplier for alpha
798     */
799    public float getColor() {
800        return vertices[C1];
801    }
802
803    /**
804     * Returns the multiplicative color tweaks used by this sprite, as a packed float with the same format as a color.
805     *
806     * @return a packed float used to multiply the L/A/B channels, as well as the setting for contrast
807     */
808    public float getColorTweak() {
809        return vertices[T1];
810    }
811
812    public void setRegion(float u, float v, float u2, float v2) {
813        super.setRegion(u, v, u2, v2);
814
815        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
816        vertices[U1] = u;
817        vertices[V1] = v2;
818
819        vertices[U2] = u;
820        vertices[V2] = v;
821
822        vertices[U3] = u2;
823        vertices[V3] = v;
824
825        vertices[U4] = u2;
826        vertices[V4] = v2;
827    }
828
829    public void setU(float u) {
830        super.setU(u);
831        vertices[U1] = u;
832        vertices[U2] = u;
833    }
834
835    public void setV(float v) {
836        super.setV(v);
837        vertices[V2] = v;
838        vertices[V3] = v;
839    }
840
841    public void setU2(float u2) {
842        super.setU2(u2);
843        vertices[U3] = u2;
844        vertices[U4] = u2;
845    }
846
847    public void setV2(float v2) {
848        super.setV2(v2);
849        vertices[V1] = v2;
850        vertices[V4] = v2;
851    }
852
853    /**
854     * Set the sprite's flip state regardless of current condition
855     *
856     * @param x the desired horizontal flip state
857     * @param y the desired vertical flip state
858     */
859    public void setFlip(boolean x, boolean y) {
860        boolean performX = false;
861        boolean performY = false;
862        if (isFlipX() != x) {
863            performX = true;
864        }
865        if (isFlipY() != y) {
866            performY = true;
867        }
868        flip(performX, performY);
869    }
870
871    /**
872     * boolean parameters x,y are not setting a state, but performing a flip
873     *
874     * @param x perform horizontal flip
875     * @param y perform vertical flip
876     */
877    public void flip(boolean x, boolean y) {
878        super.flip(x, y);
879        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
880        if (x) {
881            float temp = vertices[U1];
882            vertices[U1] = vertices[U3];
883            vertices[U3] = temp;
884            temp = vertices[U2];
885            vertices[U2] = vertices[U4];
886            vertices[U4] = temp;
887        }
888        if (y) {
889            float temp = vertices[V1];
890            vertices[V1] = vertices[V3];
891            vertices[V3] = temp;
892            temp = vertices[V2];
893            vertices[V2] = vertices[V4];
894            vertices[V4] = temp;
895        }
896    }
897
898    public void scroll(float xAmount, float yAmount) {
899        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
900        if (xAmount != 0) {
901            float u = (vertices[U1] + xAmount) % 1;
902            float u2 = u + width / getTexture().getWidth();
903            setU(u);
904            setU2(u2);
905            vertices[U1] = u;
906            vertices[U2] = u;
907            vertices[U3] = u2;
908            vertices[U4] = u2;
909        }
910        if (yAmount != 0) {
911            float v = (vertices[V2] + yAmount) % 1;
912            float v2 = v + height / getTexture().getHeight();
913            setV(v);
914            setV2(v2);
915            vertices[V1] = v2;
916            vertices[V2] = v;
917            vertices[V3] = v;
918            vertices[V4] = v2;
919        }
920    }
921}
